Class ReadWrite

  • java.lang.Object
    • ReadWrite
  • public class ReadWrite
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that we control's reading the file and putting the words into a binary tree

      • readDictionary

        public void readDictionary​(BinaryTree bt,
                           java.lang.String passed,
                           java.lang.String fileName)
        This is the method that reads the dictionary text file and adds it into the tree
        Parameters:
        bt - - The binary tree object that the user passes
        passed - - The language that the user wants to translate too
        fileName - - The file name that the user wants to save the file as.

      • readText2

        public java.lang.String readText2​(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This is the method that takes in the file of 5k words and translates it to the designated language.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - a String passed indicating what file the program should use to read in the dictionary.
        Returns:
        String value which contains the whole content of the text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - An exception in case the file is not found or runs in an error.

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile​(Node mainNode,
                      java.io.PrintWriter w,
                      java.lang.String input_lang,
                      java.lang.String fileName)
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is the method that writes the binary tree that is created into a file.
        Parameters:
        mainNode - The current active node
        w - The printwriter object
        input_lang - The input language that the user is current inputing
        fileName - - passed the fileName.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - A throw call in case the program doesn't find
